intro: Colpodium himalaicum, commonly known as the Himalayan colpodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Colpodium himalaicum is often found in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes.
